Name: Sant' Eustachio Il Caffè
Last 5 Reviews:
[]Author: Maria Bondarenko;
Rating: 4
When: 8 months ago
Super busy and not very friendly. Coffee is good but very expensive. This costs 6.8 eur

Author: Lou Mustillo;
Rating: 4
When: 8 months ago
Very good espresso and pastries, but service is slow. Good location. Staff were friendly. Many pastry choices.

Author: Tina Leong;
Rating: 5
When: 12 months ago
Best espresso I've had in my entire life. Never had espresso so creamy and smooth. Not a hint of burn/bitter taste like the ones we get in North America. Pastries were good too. I went there every day while I was in Rome for a week. I love the novelty of being able to stand by the bar and seeing the pros at work and listening to the clicking of cups, hissing of the espresso machines. Sitting is over-rated. Hey, when in Rome right. Can't wait to be back! Thank you Eustachio!

Author: Carol Murillo;
Rating: 5
When: 9 months ago
This is a must stop! This place has been her since early 50's...their coffee is amazing...I had the coffee granita with fresh whipped cream!!!

Author: Want ToGo;
Rating: 5
When: in the last week
Love the coffee, location and service. The owner’s daughter is amazingly kind. Only downside is the price. Service: 4/5 Food: 4/5 Price: 2/5

I'm updating my previous review based on more experience attending Abbey Theatre and Pub to watch sporting events. Turns out this may be the best spot in Rome to view American football and international football broadcasts in English. The food is solid. I really don't understand why pubs/restaurants are loathe to offer some of the fine, artisanal Italian beers. Best pub food in Rome.

Rating: 5

It’s a nice Irish bar, the prices of drinks & food is very reasonable and it has a lovely cozy atmosphere. It looks small when you first enter but there’s tables and booths around the corner. The barman from Liverpool was cool. He was always friendly and helpful even when he was busy. He also remembered us when we came back several days later. If you’re a traveller and looking for a comfortable and reasonably priced bar then this is for you. Recommended.

Rating: 5

Name: cybo
Last 5 Reviews:
[]Author: Jacob Payne;
Rating: 3
When: 5 months ago
Food and service was very good. Nice outside seating and beautiful indoor bar and dinning room. The only reason I am not giving 5 stars is because the price is a bit high and the bill came with over 15$ worth of food and drink that were not ordered and it was an awkward back and fourth to get the bill corrected.

Author: Carlos Mina;
Rating: 5
When: in the last week
Best meal and service in whole of our visit to Italy. The food was fantastic, the service outstanding, the drinks the best I've ever tasted, the company great and the ambience wonderful. Wish we'd had more time in Rome to visit and eat here once more , highly recommended, thanks mimmo :)

Author: Olivia Murray;
Rating: 2
When: 9 months ago
Disappointing. We saw this place had good reviews and a good menu so we decided to come here on Saturday night. We were shown to a table by a very polite and friendly waiter after being forgotten by the first waiter (the one who served us for the duration), yet were then rudely told we couldn’t sit at that table by who appeared to be the head waiter. Instead we were stuck down in the corner, while the original table remained empty. Our waiter was quite abrupt; he forgot my order, asked me again but still managed to bring the wrong starter. He also walked away from me before i could give him my drink order. We waited around 30-45 minutes for our main course, which meant that we were not offered a dessert menu as it appeared the kitchen was closed. We were ignored for another half hour while we waited to order a cocktail, even though there were only 4 tables of people, including us, and three wait staff. The food was great but you would expect better service for somewhere on the pricier end. Very disappointed with the waiter and the head waiters attitude towards us. Seemed as though we were treated poorly because we’re young and tourists. We’re all paying customers at the end of the day.

Author: Lou Mustillo;
Rating: 5
When: 8 months ago
Excellent food and service. Great selection and kids options. Also good vegetarian choices. Great pasta and pizza. Near Piazza Navona.

Author: Alex It;
Rating: 5
When: 5 months ago
There are some restaurant experiences that live on in your memory and cybo has created memories of a beautiful day In Rome where we were beautifully looked after. Thanks must go to the wonderful waiter who made us so welcome on our initial request for a table. he was and is the epitome of what you would hope for when entering a restaurant. Welcoming ,kind and appreciative of our custom. Thank you for making our day in Rome and our lunch at cybo so memorable. My wife being a Coeliac and unable to tolerate gluten was immediately reassured that the menu had a number of available options for her. We shared a gluten free pizza and carbonara with truffel and it was fabulous. The coffee was perfect and the cheerful banter from other members of the team made for an excellent lunch. You consider yourself fortunate when you come across a gem like cybo and today we felt particularly blessed. Wha a difference kindness and a smile makes to a dining experience. Particularly when the menu options available match the welcome. Thank you to all at cybo for making our time in Rome even more speciAl than we could have hoped for.

Name: Barnum Roma

Rating: 5

Great place as great as their service. Could communicate well in English and were genuinely sweet people! Was there one day for breakfast and the other for lunch and both did not disappoint. Author: Stephen Legg;
Rating: 4
When: a year ago
Fun spot down some stairs near the river and not far from attractions. Banquette that we sat in had no spring left so was basically like sitting in a valley of the couch. Beers were good and cold. Service was friendly and very accommodating to our English. Cheers!

Author: Julia P;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
This place was a highlight for my bro and I during our trip in Italia. We were walking around near Spanish Steps and it was a crazy holiday shopping day. The crowds were insufferable, so we decided to grab a drink and let the hordes of people taper off. I searched "pub" and Highlander Pub came up. The entrance is unassuming, so you might miss it if you're not looking. It's downstairs and has 2 rooms, a bar and a dining area. The bartender was this woman from Argentina who was a riot, and the conversation didn't feel forced or awkward at any point. The beer prices are average for Rome. Everyone here speaks perfect English. I would recommend this for anyone in the area looking for a true, sit-down bar experience. Also, definitely recommended for fellow beer lovers.

Name: Hostaria Da Cesare
Last 5 Reviews:
[]Author: Spionas Ribbson;
Rating: 1
When: 9 months ago
We had already had dinner and walked past on our way home and decided to get one more glass of wine before bedtime. While sitting there we asked the waitor for some snacks, maybe a couple of cheeses or something - to go with the wine. It was not on the menu but he said he could make something for us. We were super clear that we were not looking for something to eat, that we had already ate and just wanted a small snack with the wine. He ended up serving us a four different types of cheese, including a big mozzarella and then charging us €30 for it. The wine was €7/glass which was totally fine. This place really screwed us over. Don't go there!

Author: Michael Asheroff;

Author: Vorname Nachname;
Rating: 2
When: a year ago
The food is good, not great. The prices are okay. My glass was broken at the bottom and on the wine bottle the date was blacked out for whatever reason, nevermind. There are a lot of friendly waiters, the one who served my table however was very unfriendly. An old guy with white hair, near bold head. At one point he brought my dish and shouted "Eh!" to place directly on my serviette, close to pushing away my hands with the plate. The other dishes he served wordlessly and in a harsh manner. Sorry for coming to your restaurant, old man! This place shouldn't be listed in the Guide Michelin, the food doesn't make up for things like this.

Name: Enoteca Ferrara
Last 5 Reviews:
[]Author: Olive Elwell;
Rating: 5
When: 2 weeks ago
Really great cave-like restaurant in a very cute area! It may seem a bit expensive but you get a lot and the atmosphere is amazing. I will definitely go here again on the very first night I am back on holiday in Rome. It is a really special experience and the wait staff is very friendly. My boyfriend and I have little to no knowledge about wine and they helped us find a really delicious bottle in our price range. We had fried gnocchi, fried goat cheese with candied peaches, fondue gnocchi with mushrooms, stuffed guineafowl, baked goat, and tiramisu.

Rating: 4

I love the view from the balcony and the old traditional style rooms. It’s a 2-minute walk to the Clodio bus station. The staff were very friendly and informative, and spoke English well. Breakfast was delicious. The downsides were that the bed was quite firm, the bathroom was quite small and the door to the room was a bit of a hassle to open. Author: M;
Rating: 3
When: a year ago
The staff handled my problem well but I still wish I'd have gone elsewhere. Friendly service and good atmosphere but I came for a very quick dinner, ordered a sandwich, waited 20 minutes for it only to realize they gave me the wrong one. They remedied the problem quickly and gave me a few different options and the food was fine, so 3 stars, but if I had known I would be so delayed over something so simple, I would have picked any other cafe on that street. Fine if you are sitting down for a while.

The food here is fresh and tasty. Service good with friendly staff. Average price was around 10 euros. Wonderful atmosphere had outside seating as well. Can enjoy your meal with St. Peters basilica in the background.
